metadata.subject: 法學知識與英文(包括中華民國憲法、法學緒論、英文)

notes: ※注意：①本試題為單一選擇題，請選出一個正確或最適當答案。
②本科目共50題，每題2分，須用2B鉛筆在試卡上依題號清楚劃記，於本試題上作答者，不予計分。

questions.stem: 下列何者並非憲法法治國原則之內涵?
關於憲法基本國策土地利用之規定,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 私有土地應照價納稅,政府並得照價收買
options.B: 附著於土地之礦產屬於國家所有,但人民依法取得土地所有權後,附著於該土地之礦產所有權亦歸該人所有
options.C: 國家應規劃土地利用,開發農業資源,促成農業之工業化
options.D: 土地價值非因施以勞力資本而增加者,應由國家徵收土地增值稅,歸人民共享之

questions.stem: 關於憲法第10條規定人民有居住、遷徙自由之保障範圍,下列何者所受限制最大?
有關言論自由之保障,下列敘述何者正確?

options.A: 甲欲透過焚燒旗幟來表達對政府的抗議,這樣的行為無涉言論自由之保護
options.B: 猥褻言論之目的雖在傳達性的訊息,仍受言論自由之保護
options.C: 針對言論內容所做的管制規定,應與針對言論的時間與地點所做的管制規定,採相同的審查標準
options.D: 憲法對於言論自由之應有保障,僅針對積極權利行使之表意自由,不包括消極的不為表意之自由

questions.stem: 依社會救助法規定,低收入戶得申請生活扶助,此涉及何種基本權利?
大法官解釋曾宣告國軍老舊眷村改建條例之部分規定違憲,主要係違反下列那項原則?
有關租稅法律主義,依大法官解釋之意旨,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 租稅構成要件應以法律定之
options.B: 租稅主體、租稅客體、稅基、稅率應以法律定之
options.C: 稅捐稽徵之程序,應以法律定之,除有明確之法律授權,不得以命令為不同規定
options.D: 給予人民減免稅捐之優惠,非增加人民負擔,得由稅捐機關逕以命令定之

questions.stem: 依大法官解釋及憲法法庭判決,有關憲法第22條所保障之其他自由權利,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 跨國(境)婚姻媒合不得要求或期約報酬,有違憲法第22條所保障契約自由之意旨
options.B: 刑法通姦罪,係對憲法第22條性自主權之限制
options.C: 對汽車肇事駕駛人強制實施血液酒精濃度測試,構成身體權及資訊隱私權之重大限制
options.D: 以子女是否從原住民身分之父或母姓氏,為取得原住民身分之要件,侵害憲法第 22 條保障之原住民身 分認同權

questions.stem: 依相關大法官解釋及憲法法庭裁判,有關人格權之保障,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 姓名權為人格權之一種
options.B: 名譽權之保障亦在維護個人人格權
options.C: 為保護少年人格權,國家負有特別保護義務
options.D: 寵物因他人侵害致死,亦屬對飼主人格權之侵害

questions.stem: 有關總統之刑事豁免權,下列敘述何者正確?

options.A: 若發現總統有犯罪嫌疑者,得為必要之證據保全
options.B: 不得因他人刑事案件而對總統為證據調查與證據保全
options.C: 得對總統身體進行鑑定
options.D: 總統無於他人刑事案件為證人之義務

questions.stem: 依憲法及增修條文之規定,下列何者須由行政院院長副署?

options.B: 總統發布解散立法院之命令
options.C: 總統任命考試院考試委員
options.D: 總統發布審計長免職之命令

questions.stem: 依憲法及司法院大法官解釋,有關立法院召開臨時會,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 經總統之咨請,得開臨時會
options.B: 立法委員4分之1以上之請求,得開臨時會
options.C: 不信任案不得於為其他特定事項召開之立法院臨時會提出
options.D: 憲法第69條僅規範立法院臨時會召開之程序,並未限制臨時會得審議之事項

有關法院聲請釋憲之程序,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 於憲法訴訟法施行前,聲請依據為司法院釋字第371、572、590號解釋
options.B: 法院於審理案件時,對於應適用之判例,認為有牴觸憲法之疑義者,得聲請解釋
options.C: 已明文規定於憲法訴訟法第55條
options.D: 法院於審理案件時,得認定命令為違憲而逕行拒絕適用

questions.stem: 有關中央與地方自治事項之權限劃分,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 有關地方自治及中央與地方如何分權,憲法及憲法增修條文已分別就中央、省、縣之立法及執行事項, 設有明文
options.B: 直轄市之自治事項,憲法或其增修條文均無明文規定予以直接保障,而係以憲法規定授權立法院以法律 定之
options.C: 憲法除明定專屬中央立法之事項外,並同時明定有專屬地方,且中央不得干預之立法或執行事項
options.D: 監督地方自治之中央主管機關依地方制度法規定,就牴觸中央法律之自治法規,得函告無效或不予核定

questions.stem: 農業部就動物保護法第20條第2項規定之具攻擊性之寵物為何,發布公告加以定義,係屬下列何種解釋?
下列何者為適用勞動基準法之勞工?
大法官解釋宣告舊刑法第239條通姦罪違憲,下列何者與大法官解釋意旨不相符?

options.A: 刑罰對於通姦及相姦行為,無法產生嚇阻之效力
options.B: 通姦違反婚姻忠誠義務,但尚不至明顯損及公益,國家非必須使用刑罰
options.C: 對於通姦及相姦之追訴、審判過程,對個人之隱私權干預程度重大
options.D: 國家權力介入婚姻,可能會對於婚姻關係產生負面影響

依司法院大法官解釋意旨,關於法律明確性之敘述,下列何者正確?

options.A: 立法上不得運用概括條款,否則即有違法律明確性原則
options.B: 為求明確,行政處分僅限於以書面為之

options.D: 國家通訊傳播委員會主任委員

questions.stem: 依司法院釋字第775號解釋,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 刑法第 48 條前段「裁判確定後,發覺為累犯者,依前條之規定更定其刑。」之規定與憲法一事不再理 原則有違
options.B: 累犯加重本刑部分,不生違反憲法一行為不二罰原則之問題
options.C: 刑法第47條第1項之規定累犯不分情節,一律加重最低本刑,不符憲法罪刑相當原則
options.D: 累犯加重本刑之規定,與憲法意旨有違,自司法院釋字第775號解釋公布之日起失其效力

questions.stem: 有關「刑」的敘述,下列何者正確?

options.A: 主刑有四種,分別為死刑、無期徒刑、有期徒刑、罰金
options.B: 褫奪公權係褫奪為公務員之資格、為公職候選人與選舉人之資格
options.D: 有期徒刑執行未滿六個月者,不得假釋

questions.stem: 甲挑選十位當代文學作家的著作,彙整為「當代文學十大名家作品集」(以下簡稱為「A作品集」)一書。 甲就所收錄作品的選擇及編排頗具巧思,具有創作性。依我國著作權法,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: A作品集為編輯著作,可獨立受著作權法保護
options.B: 乙出版社擬出版A作品集時,除應取得甲之同意外,尚應取得所收錄個別作品之著作權人同意
options.C: 若丙擅自重製A作品集的其中一篇個別作品,僅侵害該個別作品之著作權,未侵害甲的權利
options.D: 若丁擅自重製整本A作品集,僅侵害各該個別作品之著作權,未侵害甲的權利

下列收養情況,何者原則上係得撤銷?

options.A: 8歲的甲出養給丙,未經其監護人乙之同意

questions.stem: 關於取得時效,下列敘述何者錯誤?

options.A: 未登記之不動產占有之始為善意並無過失者,取得時效期間為10年
options.B: 取得時效為不變期間,無中斷之問題
options.C: 動產占有之始為善意並無過失者,取得時效期間為5年
options.D: 地上權亦得準用取得時效之規定

questions.stem: 關於民法與刑法規定,下列敘述何者正確?

options.A: 行為之處罰,以行為時法律有明文規定者為限
options.B: 沒收與拘束行為人之自由的保安處分,應適用行為時之法律
options.C: 人之行為能力,始於出生,終於心智喪失時
options.D: 人之行為能力,以非死產者為限,視為有行為能力,並由其自然血親之生父,代其行使法律行為

questions.stem: 清治時期臺灣的婚姻型態多元,但不包括下列何者?

options.D: 神聖婚姻(一夫一妻、一生一世之婚姻型態)

questions.stem: 關於地方制度法所稱之自治條例,下列敘述何者正確?

options.A: 自治條例由地方立法機關通過,並由各該行政機關公布,其應分別冠以各該地方自治團體之名稱
options.B: 自治條例得規定罰則,但以十萬元以下之罰鍰為限,惟不得為連續處罰
options.C: 自治條例所規定之罰則僅限罰鍰,不得處以勒令停工或停止營業等不利益處分
options.D: 自治條例經地方行政機關公布後,應報中央各該主管機關轉立法院備查

questions.passage: 請依下文回答第46題至第50題 The Saharan regions of Morocco are home to the Berbers, an ethnic group native to North Africa. Madfouna—a stuffed flatbread prepared by using a handful of staple ingredients—is traditionally baked in a fire pit in the sand or a mud oven, and has long served as a wholesome meal for many Berber families. Once baked, the bread so closely resembles a pizza that it is locally nicknamed "the Berber pizza." Using an ancient Saharan bread recipe incorporating flour, yeast, salt, olive oil, and water, the dough is kneaded and then rolled into a round shape before being stretched over fillings—including beef, eggs, nuts, onions, and garlic, and herbs and spices such as cumin, paprika, turmeric, ginger, and parsley—and pinched closed. Every family has their own version of madfouna. Some use more basic ingredients such as eggs, tomatoes, and sunflower or poppy seeds, while others add almonds, cashews, olives, lamb, chicken, minced beef, or slices of cooked steak. The options are virtually endless. Whichever ingredients make up the filling, one thing is agreed upon across the region: the authentic methods of cooking madfouna in desert sands or using a mud oven undoubtedly lead to the most delicious version, complete with an unrivalled smoky taste that a modern, conventional oven cannot replicate. Today, madfouna can mostly be found in small Berber pizza takeaway joints in Rissani, a sleepy Saharan town famed for the dish. In Rissani, a slightly faster pace of life than in the desert leads to a greater demand for fast food. Tucked within the narrow streets of the market and conveniently placed near the taxi stands lie small takeaway joints with "pizza" symbols to mark where you can order a takeaway madfouna, the primary dish on the menu. It's not uncommon for these places to get so busy that people queue for more than an hour as the chefs rotate the orders in the large fire ovens. Each madfouna is so particular to each individual's tastes that locals often bring their own fillings—sourced from trusted butchers or prepared at home by family members—which they ask the chefs to bake into their orders.

questions.passage: 請依下文回答第46題至第50題 The Saharan regions of Morocco are home to the Berbers, an ethnic group native to North Africa. Madfouna—a stuffed flatbread prepared by using a handful of staple ingredients—is traditionally baked in a fire pit in the sand or a mud oven, and has long served as a wholesome meal for many Berber families. Once baked, the bread so closely resembles a pizza that it is locally nicknamed "the Berber pizza." Using an ancient Saharan bread recipe incorporating flour, yeast, salt, olive oil, and water, the dough is kneaded and then rolled into a round shape before being stretched over fillings—including beef, eggs, nuts, onions, and garlic, and herbs and spices such as cumin, paprika, turmeric, ginger, and parsley—and pinched closed. Every family has their own version of madfouna. Some use more basic ingredients such as eggs, tomatoes, and sunflower or poppy seeds, while others add almonds, cashews, olives, lamb, chicken, minced beef, or slices of cooked steak. The options are virtually endless. Whichever ingredients make up the filling, one thing is agreed upon across the region: the authentic methods of cooking madfouna in desert sands or using a mud oven undoubtedly lead to the most delicious version, complete with an unrivalled smoky taste that a modern, conventional oven cannot replicate. Today, madfouna can mostly be found in small Berber pizza takeaway joints in Rissani, a sleepy Saharan town famed for the dish. In Rissani, a slightly faster pace of life than in the desert leads to a greater demand for fast food. Tucked within the narrow streets of the market and conveniently placed near the taxi stands lie small takeaway joints with "pizza" symbols to mark where you can order a takeaway madfouna, the primary dish on the menu. It's not uncommon for these places to get so busy that people queue for more than an hour as the chefs rotate the orders in the large fire ovens. Each madfouna is so particular to each individual's tastes that locals often bring their own fillings—sourced from trusted butchers or prepared at home by family members—which they ask the chefs to bake into their orders.
